channel.title: Exercises :: C# Web Development
channel.description: As a new C# coder, it might take you some time to recognize when to use interfaces. To help overcome this, let’s consider a common occurrence — sorting a List of objects. If the list contains string or numerical entries, then sorting the list is trivial: listName.Sort(); However, if the elements are custom objects (like Cat), then sorting the list becomes more complicated. This is because the objects may contain multiple fields, any of which could be used as a sorting option.
